member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Target
member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element. > For more details about target refer to [`Custom Context`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/custom-context.html?lang=typescript) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side, and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions. > For more details about SidebarType refer to [`SidebarType`](./variations.html#types) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.IconCss
member.summary: Specifies the icon class that is used to render an icon in the Tab header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.IconPosition
member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on `iconCss` property. The possible values are: - Left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - Top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - Right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - Bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.Text
member.summary: Specifies the display text of the Tab item header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the animation configuration settings while showing the content of the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to root element of the Tab that helps to customize component styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. selectedItem

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the Tab. For the culture like Arabic, direction can be switched as right-to-left.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tab component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent. To use height property, heightAdjustMode must be set to 'None'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeightAdjustMode
member.summary: Specifies the height style for Tab content. The possible values are: - None: Based on the given height property, the content panel height is set. - Auto: Tallest panel height of a given Tab content is set to all the other panels. - Content: Based on the corresponding content height, the content panel height is set. - Fill: Based on the parent height, the content panel hight is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Toolbar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the Toolbar commands. For cultures like Arabic, Hebrew, etc. direction can be switched to right to left.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Toolbar.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Toolbar in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.summary: Specifies the mapping field for icon class of each TreeView node that will be added before the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.Id
member.summary: Specifies the ID field mapped in dataSource.

member.summary: Specifies the mapping field for image URL of each TreeView node where image will be added before the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.IsChecked
member.summary: Specifies the field for checked state of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.ParentID
member.summary: Specifies the parent ID field mapped in dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.Query
member.summary: Defines the external [`Query`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will execute along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.Selected
member.summary: Specifies the mapping field for selected state of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.TableName
member.summary: Specifies the table name used to fetch data from a specific table in the server.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.Text
member.summary: Specifies the mapping field for text displayed as TreeView node's display text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewFieldsSettings.Tooltip
member.summary: Specifies the mapping field for tooltip that will be displayed as hovering text of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings.Collapse
member.summary: Specifies the animation that applies on collapsing the nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings.Expand
member.summary: Specifies the animation that applies on expanding the nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](./drag-and-drop.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](./node-editing.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property. For more information on checkedNodes, refer to [checkedNodes](./checkbox.html#checked-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enables or disables RTL mode on the component that displays the content in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected. For more information on Fields concept, refer to [Fields](./data-binding.html#local-data).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a template to render customized content for all the nodes. If the `nodeTemplate` property is set, the template content overrides the displayed node text. The property accepts template string [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/base/template-engine.html) or HTML element ID holding the content. For more information on template concept, refer to [Template](./template.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `allowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node. For more information on selectedNodes, refer to [selectedNodes](./multi-selection.html#selected-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node. For more information on CheckBoxes, refer to [CheckBox](./checkbox.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowDragAndDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](./drag-and-drop.html).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowEditing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](./node-editing.html).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowMultiSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationAnnotationSettings.Description
member.summary: Information about annotation for assistive technology.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationAnnotationSettings.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of the annotation. They are Near - Align the annotation element as top side. Far - Align the annotation element as bottom side. Center - Align the annotation element as mid point.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationAnnotationSettings.Region
member.summary: Specifies the regions of the annotation. They are Chart - Annotation renders based on chart coordinates. Series - Annotation renders based on series coordinates.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationAnnotationSettings.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the position of the annotation. They are Top - Align the annotation element as top side. Bottom - Align the annotation element as bottom side. Middle - Align the annotation element as mid point.

member.summary: if set coordinateUnit as `Pixel` X specifies the axis value else is specifies pixel or percentage of coordinate

member.summary: if set coordinateUnit as `Pixel` Y specifies the axis value else is specifies pixel or percentage of coordinate

member.summary: The shape of the legend. Each series has its own legend shape. They are Circle - Renders a circle. Rectangle - Renders a rectangle. Triangle - Renders a triangle. Diamond - Renders a diamond. Cross - Renders a cross. HorizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. VerticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. Pentagon - Renders a pentagon. InvertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

Diamond - Renders a diamond. Cross - Renders a cross. HorizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. VerticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. Pentagon - Renders a pentagon. InvertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

member.summary: Specifies the position of labels at the edge of the axis.They are, None: No action will be performed. Hide: Edge label will be hidden. Shift: Shifts the edge labels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.EnableAutoIntervalOnZooming
member.summary: If set to true, axis interval will be calculated automatically with respect to the zoomed range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the interval for an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.IntervalType
member.summary: Specifies the types like `Years`, `Months`, `Days`, `Hours`, `Minutes`, `Seconds` in date time axis.They are, Auto: Defines the interval of the axis based on data. Years: Defines the interval of the axis in years. Months: Defines the interval of the axis in months. Days: Defines the interval of the axis in days. Hours: Defines the interval of the axis in hours. Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.IsIndexed
member.summary: Specifies indexed category axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.IsInversed
member.summary: It specifies whether the axis to be rendered in inversed manner or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelFormat
member.summary: Used to format the axis label that accepts any global string format like 'C', 'n1', 'P' etc. It also accepts placeholder like '{value}°C' in which value represent the axis label, e.g, 20°C.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `Hide`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the placement of a label for category axis. They are, betweenTicks: Renders the label between the ticks. onTicks: Renders the label on the ticks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelPosition
member.summary: Specifies the placement of a labels to the axis line. They are, inside: Renders the labels inside to the axis line. outside: Renders the labels outside to the axis line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableDeferredZooming

member.summary: If set to true, chart can be zoomed by using mouse wheel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnablePan
member.summary: Specifies whether chart needs to be panned by default.

member.summary: If to true, chart can be pinched to zoom in / zoom out.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableScrollbar
member.summary: Specifies whether axis needs to have scrollbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableSelectionZooming

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.Mode

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.ToolbarItems
member.summary: Specifies the toolkit options for the zooming as follows: Zoom ZoomIn ZoomOut Pan Reset

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SelectionMode
member.summary: Defines the SelectionMode, They are. none - Disable the selection. series - To select a series. point - To select a point. cluster - To select a cluster of point dragXY - To select points, by dragging with respect to both horizontal and vertical axis dragX - To select points, by dragging with respect to horizontal axis. dragY - To select points, by dragging with respect to vertical axis.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartTheme
member.summary: Defines Theme of the chart. They are Material - Render a chart with Material theme. Fabric - Render a chart with Fabric theme

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.BoxPlotMode
member.summary: Defines the BoxPlotMode for box and whisker chart series, They are. exclusive - Series render based on exclusive mode. inclusive - Series render based on inclusive mode. normal - Series render based on normal mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartDrawType
member.summary: Type of series to be drawn in radar or polar series. They are line - Renders the line series. column - Renders the column series. area - Renders the area series. scatter - Renders the scatter series. spline - Renders the spline series. stackingColumn - Renders the stacking column series. stackingArea - Renders the stacking area series. rangeColumn - Renders the range column series. splineArea - Renders the spline area series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LegendShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of legend. They are circle - Renders a circle. rectangle - Renders a rectangle. triangle - Renders a triangle. diamond - Renders a diamond. cross - Renders a cross. horizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. verticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. pentagon - Renders a pentagon. invertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Segment
member.summary: Defines the segment axis. They are, X - Segment calculation rendered based on horizontal axis Y - Segment calculation rendered based on vertical axis

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SplineType
member.summary: It defines type of spline. Natural - Used to render Natural spline. Cardinal - Used to render cardinal spline. Clamped - Used to render Clamped spline Monotonic - Used to render monotonic spline

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartSeriesType
member.summary: Defines the type series in chart. They are line - Renders the line series. column - Renders the column series. area - Renders the area series. pie - Renders the pie series. polar - Renders the polar series. radar - Renders the radar series. bar - Renders the stacking column series histogram - Renders the histogram series stackingColumn - Renders the stacking column series. stackingArea - Renders the stacking area series stackingBar - Renders the stacking bar series. StackingColumn100 - Renders the stacking column series. StackingArea100 - Renders the stacking area 100 percent series StackingBar100 - Renders the stacking bar 100 percent series. stepLine - Renders the step line series. stepArea - Renders the step area series. scatter - Renders the scatter series. spline - Renders the spline series rangeColumn - Renders the rangeColumn series. hilo - Renders the hilo series hiloOpenClose - Renders the HiloOpenClose Series Waterfall - Renders the Waterfall Series rangeArea - Renders the rangeArea series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TrendlineTypes
member.summary: Defines the type of trendlines. They are Linear - Defines the linear trendline Exponential - Defines the exponential trendline Polynomial - Defines the polynomial trendline Power - Defines the power trendline Logarithmic - Defines the logarithmic trendline MovingAverage - Defines the moving average trendline

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of marker. They are circle - Renders a circle. rectangle - Renders a rectangle. triangle - Renders a triangle. diamond - Renders a diamond. cross - Renders a cross. horizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. verticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. pentagon- Renders a pentagon. invertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. image - Renders a image.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Alignment
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are near - Align the element to the left. center - Align the element to the center. far - Align the element to the right.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelPosition
member.summary: Defines the LabelPosition, They are. outer - Position the label outside the point. top - Position the label on top of the point. bottom - Position the label on bottom of the point. middle - Position the label to middle of the point. auto - Position the label based on series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines the Text overflow. None - Shown the chart title with overlap if exceed. Wrap - Shown the chart title with wrap if exceed. Trim - Shown the chart title with trim if exceed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of error bar. They are both - Renders both direction of error bar. minus - Renders minus direction of error bar. plus - Renders plus direction error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarMode
member.summary: Defines the modes of error bar. They are vertical - Renders a vertical error bar. horizontal - Renders a horizontal error bar. both - Renders both side error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarType
member.summary: Defines the type of error bar. They are fixed - Renders a fixed type error bar. percentage - Renders a percentage type error bar. standardDeviation - Renders a standard deviation type error bar. standardError -Renders a standard error type error bar. custom -Renders a custom type error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.EmptyPointMode
member.summary: Defines the empty point mode of the chart. Gap - Used to display empty points as space. Zero - Used to display empty points as zero. Drop - Used to ignore the empty point while rendering. Average - Used to display empty points as previous and next point average.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccEmptyPointMode
member.summary: Defines the empty point mode of the chart. Zero - Used to display empty points as zero. Drop - Used to ignore the empty point while rendering. Average - Used to display empty points as previous and next point average.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.EdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Edge Label Placement for an axis. They are none - No action will be perform. hide - Edge label will be hidden. shift - Shift the edge labels.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.IntervalType
member.summary: Defines the interval type of datetime axis. They are auto - Define the interval of the axis based on data. years - Define the interval of the axis in years. months - Define the interval of the axis in months. days - Define the interval of the axis in days. hours - Define the interval of the axis in hours. minutes - Define the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are none - Shows all the labels. hide - Hide the label when it intersect. rotate45 - Rotate the label to 45 degree when it intersect. rotate90 - Rotate the label to 90 degree when it intersect.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Label Placement for category axis. They are betweenTicks - Render the label between the ticks. onTicks - Render the label on the ticks.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AxisPosition
member.summary: Defines the Position. They are inside - Place the ticks or labels inside to the axis line. outside - Place the ticks or labels outside to the axis line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartRangePadding
member.summary: Defines the range padding of axis. They are none - Padding cannot be applied to the axis. normal - Padding is applied to the axis based on the range calculation. additional - Interval of the axis is added as padding to the minimum and maximum values of the range. round - Axis range is rounded to the nearest possible value divided by the interval.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SkeletonType
member.summary: Defines the skeleton type for the axis. Date - it formats date only. DateTime - it formats date and time. Time - it formats time only.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ValueType
member.summary: Defines the type of axis. They are double - Renders a numeric axis. dateTime - Renders a dateTime axis. category - Renders a category axis. logarithmic - Renders a log axis. DateTimeCategory - Renders a datetime DateTimeCategory axis

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Anchor
member.summary: Defines the strip line text position. Start - Places the strip line text at the start. Middle - Places the strip line text in the middle. End - Places the strip line text at the end.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the order of the strip line. `Over` | `Behind`. Over - Places the strip line over the series elements. Behind - laces the strip line behind the series elements.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Units
member.summary: Defines Coordinate units of an annotation. They are Pixel Point

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Regions
member.summary: Defines regions of an annotation. They are Chart Series

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Position
member.summary: Defines the Position. They are top - Align the element to the top. middle - Align the element to the center. bottom - Align the element to the bottom.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.FinancialDataFields
member.summary: Defines the financial data fields High - Represents the highest price in the stocks over time Low - Represents the lowest price in the stocks over time Open - Represents the opening price in the stocks over time Close - Represents the closing price in the stocks over time

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TechnicalIndicators
member.summary: Defines the type of technical indicators. They are Sma - Predicts the trend using Simple Moving Average approach Ema - Predicts the trend using Exponential Moving Average approach Tma - Predicts the trend using Triangle Moving Average approach Atr - Predicts the trend using Average True Range approach AccumulationDistribution - Predicts the trend using Accumulation Distribution approach Momentum - Predicts the trend using Momentum approach Rsi - Predicts the trend using RSI approach Macd - Predicts the trend using Moving Average Convergence Divergence approach Stochastic - Predicts the trend using Stochastic approach BollingerBands - Predicts the trend using Bollinger approach

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LineType
member.summary: Defines the mode of line in crosshair. They are none - Hides both vertical and horizontal crosshair line. both - Shows both vertical and horizontal crosshair line. vertical - Shows the vertical line. horizontal - Shows the horizontal line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LegendPosition
member.summary: Defines the position of the legend. They are auto - Places the legend based on area type. top - Displays the legend on the top of chart. left - Displays the legend on the left of chart. bottom - Displays the legend on the bottom of chart. right - Displays the legend on the right of chart. custom - Displays the legend based on given x and y value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ZoomMode
member.summary: Defines the zooming mode, They are. x,y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to both vertical and horizontal axis. x - Chart will be zoomed with respect to horizontal axis. y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to vertical axis.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.GroupModes

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.PyramidModes

member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.AllowCustom
member.summary: Specifies whether the component allows user defined value which does not exist in data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.AllowFiltering
member.summary: When allowFiltering is set to true, show the filter bar (search box) of the component. The filter action retrieves matched items through the `filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox. If no match is found, the value of the `noRecordsTemplate` property will be displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Autofill
member.summary: Specifies whether suggest a first matched item in input when searching. No action happens when no matches found.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.CssClass
member.summary: Sets CSS classes to the root element of the component that allows customization of appearance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.DataSource
member.summary: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component. It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of [`DataManager`](./api-dataManager.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: When set to true, enables RTL mode of the component that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Fields
member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item. value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item. iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item. groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.CssClass
member.summary: Sets CSS classes to the root element of the component that allows customization of appearance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.DataSource
member.summary: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component. It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of [`DataManager`](./api-dataManager.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.EnableRtl
member.summary: When set to true, enables RTL mode of the component that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Fields
member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item. value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item. iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item. groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.GroupTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup. We have built-in [`template engine`](./template-engine.html)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.NoRecordsTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to popup list of component when no data is available on the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the DropDownList component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.PopupHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.PopupWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Query
member.summary: Accepts the external [`Query`](./api-query.html) that execute along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Readonly
member.summary: When set to true, the user interactions on the component are disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button. When the clear button is clicked, `value`, `text`, and `index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies the `sortOrder` to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are `None` - The data source is not sorting. `Ascending` - The data source is sorting with ascending order. `Descending` - The data source is sorting with descending order.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the selected item in the component.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the selected item in the component.

member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the component. By default, the component width sets based on the width of its parent container. You can also set the width in pixel values.

member.summary: Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`. When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.

Refer the documentation {@link https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/calendar/calendar-views.html?lang=typescript here} to know more about this property with demo.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text to be floated. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Format
member.summary: Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component. By default, the format is based on the culture. > For more details refer to [`Format`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/demos/#/material/datepicker/date-format.html) sample.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.summary: Specifies the component in readonly state. > For more details refer to [`Readonly`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/datepicker/how-to.html?lang=typescript#set-the-readonly) documentation.

member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear Icon.

member.summary: Specifies whether the today button is displayed or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view. Refer the documentation {@link https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/calendar/calendar-views.html?lang=typescript here} to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.StrictMode
member.summary: Specifies the component to act as strict. So that, it allows to enter only a valid date value within a specified range or else it will resets to previous value. By default, strictMode is in false. > For more details refer to [`Strict Mode`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/datepicker/strict-mode.html?lang=typescript) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies the component to be disabled or not. > For more details refer to [`Disabled State`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/datepicker/how-to.html?lang=typescript#disabled-state) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture. > For more details about firstDayOfWeek refer to [`First day of week`](./how-to.html#change-the-first-day-of-the-week) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text to be floated. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Format
member.summary: Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component. By default, the format is based on the culture. > For more details refer to [`Format`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/demos/#/material/datepicker/date-format.html) sample.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date that can be selected in the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the Calendar.

member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text that to be is displayed in textbox.

member.summary: Specifies the component in readonly state. > For more details refer to [`Readonly`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/datepicker/how-to.html?lang=typescript#set-the-readonly) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon in textbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.ShowTodayButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the today button is displayed or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view. Refer the documentation {@link https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/calendar/calendar-views.html?lang=typescript here} to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Step
member.summary: Specifies the time interval between the two adjacent time values in the time popup list .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.StrictMode
member.summary: Specifies the component whether to act as strict or not. So that, it allows to enter only a valid datetime value or else it will resets to previous value. By default, strictMode is in false. > For more details refer to [`Strict Mode`] (https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/datetimepicker/strict-mode.html?lang=typescript) documentation.

member.summary: Specifies the format of the time value that to be displayed in time popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.CustomCharacters
member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox. In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.
For more information on customCharacters, refer to [customCharacters](./mask-configuration.html#custom-characters).

member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the RTL mode on the MaskedTextBox. If it is true, MaskedTextBox will display the content in the right to left direction.

member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: Never - The floating label will not be enable when the placeholder is available. Always - The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox. Auto - The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow/validate the user input. Mask allows as mask elements. For more information on mask, refer to [mask](./mask-configuration.html#standard-mask-elements). If the mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order. If the chunk size property has value, the uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server. The remove action type must be POST request and define “removeFileNames” attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server. The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderButtonsProps.Browse
member.summary: Specifies the text or html content to browse button

member.summary: Specifies the text or html content to clear button

member.summary: Specifies the name of the file

member.summary: Specifies the size of the file

member.summary: Specifies the type of the file

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary: Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators. For example, if you want to upload specific image files, pass allowedExtensions as “.jpg,.png”.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AutoUpload
member.summary: By default, the uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue. If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the autoUpload property. The buttons “upload” and “clear” will be hided from file list when autoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Buttons
member.summary: You can customize the default text of “browse, clear, and upload” buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons’ text can be customized from localization also. If you configured both locale and buttons property, the uploader component considers the buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the component creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: When this property is enabled, the uploader component elements are aligned from right-to-left direction to support locales.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies Boolean value that indicates whether the component is enabled or disabled. The uploader component does not allow to interact when this property is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Files
member.summary: Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server. By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files: Name Size Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Canceling
member.summary: Fires if cancel the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Change
member.summary: Triggers when changes occur in uploaded file list by selecting or dropping files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ChunkFailure
member.summary: Fires if the chunk file failed to upload.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ChunkSuccess
member.summary: Fires when the chunk file uploaded successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Clearing
member.summary: Triggers before clearing the items in file list when clicking “clear”.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Created
member.summary: Triggers when the component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Failure
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request fails on uploading or removing files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Pausing
member.summary: Fires if pause the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Progress
member.summary: Triggers when uploading a file to the server using the AJAX request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Resuming
member.summary: Fires if resume the paused chunk file upload.

member.summary: Triggers after selecting or dropping the files by adding the files in upload queue.

member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request gets success on uploading files or removing files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Uploading
member.summary: Triggers when the upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettingsBuilder.ChunkSize(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order. If the chunk size property has value, the uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettingsBuilder.RemoveUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server. The remove action type must be POST request and define “removeFileNames” attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettingsBuilder.RetryAfterDelay(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettingsBuilder.RetryCount(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettingsBuilder.SaveUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server. The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderBuilder.AllowedExtensions(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators. For example, if you want to upload specific image files, pass allowedExtensions as “.jpg,.png”.

member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.BridgeDirection
member.summary: Defines the bridge direction Top - Defines the direction of the bridge as Top Bottom - Defines the direction of the bridge as Bottom Left - Sets the bridge direction as left Right - Sets the bridge direction as right

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramConstraints
member.summary: Enables/Disables certain features of diagram None - Disable DiagramConstraints constraints Bridging - Enables/Disable Bridging support for connector UndoRedo - Enables/Disable the Undo/Redo support Tooltip - Enables/Disable Tooltip support UserInteraction - Enables/Disable UserInteraction support for the diagram ApiUpdate - Enables/Disable ApiUpdate support for the diagram PageEditable - Enables/Disable PageEditable support for the diagram Zoom - Enables/Disable Zoom support for the diagram PanX - Enables/Disable PanX support for the diagram PanY - Enables/Disable PanY support for the diagram Pan - Enables/Disable Pan support the diagram Default - Enables/Disable all constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.RenderingMode
member.summary: Defines the rendering mode of the diagram SVG - Renders the diagram objects as SVG elements Canvas - Renders the diagram in a canvas

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTools
member.summary: Activates the diagram tools None - Enables/Disable single select support for the diagram SingleSelect - Enables/Disable single select support for the diagram MultipleSelect - Enables/Disable MultipleSelect select support for the diagram ZoomPan - Enables/Disable ZoomPan support for the diagram DrawOnce - Enables/Disable continuousDraw support for the diagram continuousDraw - Enables/Disable continuousDraw support for the diagram Default - Enables/Disable all constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ConnectorConstraints
member.summary: Defines the constraints to enable/disable certain features of connector. None - Interaction of the connectors cannot be done. Select - Selects the connector. Delete - Delete the connector. Drag - Drag the connector. DragSourceEnd - Drag the source end of the connector. DragTargetEnd - Drag the target end of the connector. DragSegmentThump - Drag the segment thumb of the connector. AllowDrop - Allow to drop a node. Bridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. BridgeObstacle - InheritBridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. PointerEvents - Sets the pointer events. Tooltip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. InheritToolTip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. Interaction - Features of the connector used for interaction. ReadOnly - Enables ReadOnly Default - Default features of the connector.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.Segments
member.summary: Defines the segment type of the connector Straight - Sets the segment type as Straight Orthogonal - Sets the segment type as Orthogonal Bezier - Sets the segment type as Bezier

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.AnnotationAlignment
member.summary: Defines how the annotations have to be aligned with respect to its immediate parent Center - Aligns the annotation at the center of a connector segment Before - Aligns the annotation before a connector segment After - Aligns the annotation after a connector segment

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.AnnotationConstraints
member.summary: Enables/Disables the annotation constraints ReadOnly - Enables/Disables the ReadOnly Constraints InheritReadOnly - Enables/Disables the InheritReadOnly Constraints Default - Enables/Disables Default constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Defines how the diagram elements have to be aligned with respect to its immediate parent Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout its immediate parent Left - Aligns the diagram element at the left of its immediate parent Right - Aligns the diagram element at the right of its immediate parent Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of its immediate parent Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of its immediate parent

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.AnnotationTypes
member.summary: Defines the type of the annotation Shape - Sets the annotation type as Shape Path - Sets the annotation type as Path

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Defines how the diagram elements have to be aligned with respect to its immediate parent Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout its immediate parent Top - Aligns the diagram element at the top of its immediate parent Bottom - Aligns the diagram element at the bottom of its immediate parent Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of its immediate parent Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of its immediate parent

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines how the text has to be aligned Left - Aligns the text at the left of the text bounds Right - Aligns the text at the right of the text bounds Center - Aligns the text at the center of the text bounds Justify - Aligns the text in a justified manner

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextDecoration
member.summary: Defines how to decorate the text Overline - Decorates the text with a line above the text Underline - Decorates the text with an underline LineThrough - Decorates the text by striking it with a line None - Text will not have any specific decoration

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines how to handle the text when it exceeds the element bounds Wrap - Wraps the text to next line, when it exceeds its bounds Ellipsis - It truncates the overflown text and represents the clipping with an ellipsis Clip - It clips the overflow text

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextWrap
member.summary: Defines how to wrap the text when it exceeds the element bounds WrapWithOverflow - Wraps the text so that no word is broken Wrap - Wraps the text and breaks the word, if necessary NoWrap - Text will no be wrapped

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.WhiteSpace
member.summary: Defines how to handle the empty space and empty lines of a text PreserveAll - Preserves all empty spaces and empty lines CollapseSpace - Collapses the consequent spaces into one CollapseAll - Collapses all consequent empty spaces and empty lines

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.GradientType
member.summary: Defines the type of the gradient Linear - Sets the type of the gradient as Linear Radial - Sets the type of the gradient as Radial

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ConnectionShapes

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TooltipRelativeMode

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.NodeConstraints
member.summary: Enables/Disables certain features of node None - Disable all node Constraints Select - Enables node to be selected Drag - Enables node to be Dragged Rotate - Enables node to be Rotate Shadow - Enables node to display shadow PointerEvents - Enables node to provide pointer option Delete - Enables node to delete InConnect - Enables node to provide in connect option OutConnect - Enables node to provide out connect option Individual - Enables node to provide individual resize option Expandable - Enables node to provide Expandable option AllowDrop - Enables node to provide allow to drop option Inherit - Enables node to inherit the interaction option ResizeNorthEast - Enable ResizeNorthEast of the node ResizeEast - Enable ResizeEast of the node ResizeSouthEast - Enable ResizeSouthEast of the node ResizeSouth - Enable ResizeSouthWest of the node ResizeSouthWest - Enable ResizeSouthWest of the node ResizeSouth - Enable ResizeSouth of the node ResizeSouthWest - Enable ResizeSouthWest of the node ResizeWest - Enable ResizeWest of the node ResizeNorth - Enable ResizeNorth of the node Resize - Enables the Aspect ratio fo the node AspectRatio - Enables the Aspect ratio fo the node Tooltip - Enables or disables tool tip for the Nodes InheritTooltip - Enables or disables tool tip for the Nodes ReadOnly - Enables the ReadOnly support for Annotation Default - Enables all constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.PortConstraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.PortShapes

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.PortVisibility
member.summary: Constraints to define when a port has to be visible Visible - Always shows the port Hidden - Always hides the port Hover - Shows the port when the mouse hovers over a node Connect - Shows the port when a connection end point is dragged over a node Default - By default the ports will be visible when a node is hovered and being tried to connect

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ScrollLimit
member.summary: Defines the scrollable region of diagram Diagram - Enables scrolling to view the diagram content Infinity - Diagram will be extended, when we try to scroll the diagram

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.SnapConstraints
member.summary: Defines the constraints to Enables / Disables some features of Snapping. None - Snapping does not happen ShowHorizontalLines - Displays only the horizontal gridlines in diagram. ShowVerticalLines - Displays only the Vertical gridlines in diagram. ShowLines - Display both Horizontal and Vertical gridlines. SnapToHorizontalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToVerticalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToLines - Enables the object to snap with both horizontal and Vertical gridlines. snapToObject - Enables the object to snap with the other objects in the diagram.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.PageOrientation

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on open and close the dialog. If user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with `FadeIn` effect and close with `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogDialogButton.ButtonModel
member.summary: Specifies the button component properties to render the dialog buttons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-position the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.AnimationSettings
member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the dialog component. The animation effect can be applied on open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Buttons
member.summary: Configures the action `buttons` that contains button properties with primary attributes and click events. One or more action buttons can be configured to the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the dialog can be closed with the escape key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in dialog's content area. It can be information, list, or other HTML elements. The content of dialog can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with dialog's footer area. This is optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with action [buttons](#buttons). If footer template is configured to dialog, the action buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with plain text or HTML elements. This is optional property and the dialog can be displayed without header, if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates overlay that disable interaction with the parent application and user should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Position
member.summary: Specifies the value where the dialog can be positioned within the document or target. The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. `X value`: left, center, right, or offset value. `Y value`: top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon is shown in the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which to display the dialog. The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.BeforeClose
member.summary: Event triggers before the dialog is closed. If you cancel this event, the dialog remains opened. Set the cancel argument to true to cancel the closure of a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.BeforeOpen
member.summary: Event triggers when the dialog is being opened. If you cancel this event, the dialog remains closed. Set the cancel argument to true to cancel the open of a dialog.

member.summary: Event triggers after the dialog has been closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Popup.ActionOnScroll
member.summary: specifies the action that should happen when scroll the target-parent container. This property should define either `reposition` or `hide`. when set `reposition` to this property, the popup position will refresh when scroll any parent container. when set `hide` to this property, the popup will be closed when scroll any parent container.
